title: Lesson 60 - After and Then; Pagka, Tapos and Pagkatapos

vocabulary.english: adverb prefix that adds the nuance “after”

contents.markdown: This lesson covers some common ways to say “after” and “then” in Tagalog. There is some overlap between _pagka-, tapos_ and _pagkatapos_, so we will cover them together in this lesson.
<u>Pagka-</u>
The prefix _pagka-_ can be used to create an adverb of time with the nuance “after”. Be careful not to confuse this with _pag + ka_, which you used to make gerunds for certain verb roots.
pagka + root + noun (Tag.) = after noun verbed (Eng.)
**Notes: These are adverbs of time; noun takes _ng_ form.**

item.tagalog: Pagkakain nila, ininom nila ang tubig.
item.english: After they ate, they drank the water.

item.tagalog: Umuwi si Joshua pagkamatay ng aso niya.
item.english: Joshua went home after his dog died.

item.tagalog: Pagkaaral ni Maria, nagbisikleta siya papunta sa bahay ni Joe.
item.english: After Maria studied, she bicycled to Joe’s house.

contents.markdown: <u>Tapos </u>
_Tapos_ is an adverb of time that roughly means “then”. It can go in front of the sentence, or join two phrases.

item.tagalog: Tapos, nagmaneho ako papunta sa Maynila.
item.english: Then, I drove to Manila.

item.tagalog: Nag-aral siya, tapos kumain sa amin.
item.english: She studied, then ate at our (excl.) place.

item.tagalog: Tapos?
item.english: And then? So...?

contents.markdown: But _tapós na_ is an adjective that means “after” or “finished”. Notice that the stress is different from _tapos_. With a clause:
\*\*Tapos\*\*+ na + linker + clause. (Tag.) = Actor is finished clausing. (Eng.)
**Note: The verb takes infinitive form.**

item.tagalog: Tapos na siyang magluto.
item.english: She finished cooking.

item.tagalog: Tapos nang magluto si Maria.
item.english: Maria finished cooking.

item.tagalog: Tapos na niyang gawin yun.
item.english: He is finished doing that.

contents.markdown: With a noun phrase:
\*\*Tapos\*\*+ na + name/pp + noun phrase. (Tag.) = Name/pp is finished phrasing. (Eng.)
**Note: To focus on the actor, name/pp takes _ang_ form, and noun phrase takes _sa_ form. To focus on the noun phrase, name/pp takes _ng_ form, and noun phrase takes _ang_ form.**

item.tagalog: Tapos na ako sa halo-halo.
item.english: I completed the halo-halo. Focus is on name/pp.

item.tagalog: Tapos na ni Maria ang halo-halo.
item.english: Maria completed the halo-halo. Focus on phrase.

item.tagalog: Tapos na ang bahay nila.
item.english: Their house is finished. There is no name/pp.

contents.markdown: <u>Pagkatapos</u>
_Pagkatapos_ is just the _pagka_ prefix shown above used with the tapos root to form an adverb of time which roughly means “after”. It can be used before a verb:
\*\*pagkatapos\*\*+ linker + verb (Tag.) = after verbing (Eng.)
**Notes: Verb takes infinitive form, actor takes _ng_ form. Use the linker if it is -_ng_ type, but omit it if it is _na_.**

Similar to the adj + infinitive and pseudo verb structures, although the linker is optional here, native speakers will normally use it if can be an -_ng_ type modification, but omit it where it would be _na_, so that is what we do in this book.

item.tagalog: Pagkatapos mong manalo, umalis ako.
item.english: After you won, I left.

item.tagalog: Pagkatapos kumain ni Maria, umuwi siya.
item.english: After Maria ate, she went home.

item.tagalog: Maglalaro tayo pagkatapos kumain.
item.english: We (incl.) will play after eating.

contents.markdown: Notice that the infinitive is used for “eating” here, not a _pag_- noun.

item.tagalog: Pagkatapos na maging guro, ibinili ni Joshua ng sasakyan ang asawa niya.
item.english: After becoming a teacher, Joshua bought a car for his wife.

contents.markdown: It can also be used before an event:
\*\*pagkatapos\*\*+ event (Tag.) = after the event (Eng.)
**Note: Event takes _ng_ form.**

item.tagalog: Pagkatapos ng pagkain, natulog kami.
item.english: After the food, we (excl.) slept.

item.tagalog: Mas maganda ang mga puno pagkatapos ng ulan.
item.english: The trees are more beautiful after the rain.

item.tagalog: Pagkatapos ng gabi, nasa bahay si Jessica.
item.english: After the night, Jessica was at home.

contents.markdown: _Pagkatapos_ can also mean “then”:

item.tagalog: Nag-aral siya at kumain sa amin pagkatapos.
item.english: She studied, and ate at our (excl.) place then.

contents.markdown: But this is less common than using _tapos_, so we will not use it from now on.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Bakit hindi siya matututo ng Ingles, tapos pupunta sa Seattle?
exampleSentences.english: Why won't she learn English, then go to Seattle?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Pagkatapos ng isang oras, sabi ni Joshua, “Nakanino siya?”
exampleSentences.english: After one hour, Joshua said, "Whose place is she at?" (pagkatapos)

exampleSentences.tagalog: Tapos ko na tanungin ang mga tanong.
exampleSentences.english: I am finished asking the questions.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Pagkamatay ng anak ni Analyn, naging mahirap ang pagtuturo.
exampleSentences.english: After Analyn's child died, teaching became difficult. (pagka-)

exampleSentences.tagalog: Namasyal siya nang maraming oras, tapos napunta dito, kaya kumusta siya?
exampleSentences.english: She took a walk for many hours, then wound up here, so how is she?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Talaga? Pagkatapos hanapin ang kaninong pusa?
exampleSentences.english: Really? After searching for whose cat? (pagkatapos)

exampleSentences.tagalog: Tapos na sila sa atin, di ba? Gaano kainit sa labas ngayon?
exampleSentences.english: They are finished with us(incl.), right? How hot is it outside now?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Pagkaaral namin, nagpapunta ng bus sa tindahan ang guro.
exampleSentences.english: After we studied, the teacher had a bus go to the store. (pagka-)

exampleSentences.tagalog: Paano mo niluto ang manok, tapos kinain ito nang ganun kabilis?
exampleSentences.english: How did you cook the chicken, then eat it so fast?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Pagkatapos manalo ni Joe ng pera, papagawain niya si David ng bahay.
exampleSentences.english: After Joe wins some money, he will have David build a house. (pagkatapos)
